answers.answer: If she's measuring two weeks early by your fundal height I wouldn't worry. Those aren't very accurate and can be off because of numerous things. Women with gestational diabetes tend to have big babies, and it's easily manageable with a healthy diet and exercise. I wouldn't worry about it.
Thank u so much maybe I can funtion now at work because they called me soon as I got to work and I took that about a week or so ago they said I would know the next day so I thought I passed

Don't worry!!!! I had gd in my last pregnancy & it turned out to be a complete blessing, I lost weight and at full term weighed only 1kg more than pre pregnancy, so dropped about 10kg instantly when my super healthy 7pd15oz baby girl was born. The gd was also a great kick in the butt to change my diet and almost straight away I felt so much healthier and less slugish all the time. I'm off for my test for this pregnancy this morning, a little nervous but I'm sure it'll be fine!!

I fail my one hour test too. Just got done with my 3 hrs retest and keeping my fingers cross. Since I'm Asian, my doctor told me a lot of her Asian patients seem to fail the test, it's not anything to worry about too much. I don't even like sweets. But I was told it could be due to the high amount of rice intake in our diet. So now I wait and see...

My daughter failed hers too. She failed the 3 hr test. Which btw she is very healthy. She was of average weight when she got pregnant, lost 9# during the 1st trimester bc of morning sickness. Now she weighs 1# more than when she got pregnant, so technically she has gained 10#. She is almost 30 wks. Her dr is sending her to the diabetes clinic at the hosp
I'm done worrying. I love sweets but I'm cut them out once I have my baby

question: I took my glucose test and failed it now I took one 4yrd agowith my 4yrold nd failed and had to retest and passed it. Well I'm so nervous about this one because they already said she is measuring 2weeks early should I worry
title: very sad
